metadata.title: httpd: Potential SSRF in mod_rewrite (moderate)
metadata.description:
DOCUMENTATION: A flaw was found in the mod_rewrite module of httpd. A potential SSRF allows an attacker to cause unsafe RewriteRules to unexpectedly set up URLs to be handled by the mod_proxy module. 
            STATEMENT: This flaw requires mod_rewrite and mod_proxy to be loaded and being used. These modules can be disabled via the configuration file if their functionality are not needed.
            MITIGATION: Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options do not meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 is installed
jbcs-httpd24-httpd is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
